julia.code: # Based on the introductory discussion on # https://www.maa.org/press/periodicals/loci/joma/the-sir-model-for-spread-of-disease-the-differential-equation-model ## Uncomment the following lines if used as a standalone # using DifferentialEquations # using Plots function SIR(du, u, p, t) s, i, r = u b, k = p du[1] = -b * s * i du[2] = b * s * i - k * i du[3] = k * i end # TODO: make the following a doctest example # #initian conditions # p = [0.5/7900000.0,0.33] # u0 = [7900000.0,10.0,0.0] # tspan = (0.0,140.0) # #solve # sir = ODEProblem(SIR,u0,tspan,p) # sol = solve(sir) # #plot # plot(sol)
